title: Navigating to a legacy PHP page outside of React but inside the same domain as the React app
body: I have components which I route to using react router dom. I am deploying this application to a existing PHP application and created some links inside of the application that point to the same domain but at a path where the external PHP application lives. When a link is clicked the navigation takes the user to a page that is obviously still inside of the React application. I would assume that I should be able to navigate outside of the React application even though I am on the same domain as it so I assume React removing my ability to do so is a bug. ## Version "react": "^16.1.0", "react-router-dom": "^4.2.2", ## Test Case I am deploying a react application to be part of a existing website. In some cases I need to navigate my users outside of the react application but keep them inside of the domain. For example if I am using React Router Dom in my app and I try to do this, ``` Login ``` or this, ``` (window.location = 'https://www.example.com/financial-products.html/')}> Financial Products ``` ## Steps to reproduce Create react project, and create a link that navigates to a component in the React application. Then make a link that navigates to a php page outside of the react application but in the same domain. ## Expected Behavior The link should navigate to the correct page which is not inside of the React application. ## Actual Behavior The app navigates to a blank react page only showing the header and footer. In other words it will not leave the react application.
